titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph Lemuel Chester papers, 1843-1880 MS 146

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-01 17:25:38 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: This collection contains Joseph Lemuel Chester's writing and correspondence.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Joseph L. Chester was born in Norwich, Connecticut in 1821. After a brief school-teaching experience in Ballston, New York, he removed to New York City where he became interested in politics and then journalism. In 1845 he moved to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania where he spent the rest of his life. He was a poet, writer, City Council member, anti-slavery spokesman and an avid genealogist. He died in 1882.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of five items: an original copyright document for Chester's book "Greenwood Cemetery and Other Poems", a handwritten poem entitled "To Georgie", an undated leaflet of several printed poems, and two letters of a personal nature from correspondents in Blackheath, South Carolina.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Purchased November 1961. Recommended by Rice History Professor Hardin Craig

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joseph Lemuel Chester Papers, 1843-1880, MS146, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Joseph Lemuel Chester Papers, 1843-1880 must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.
